results.title: Ohnar 16MM Editor Viewer
results.brief_description: Film viewing and editing devices like the Ohnar provided amatuer filmmakers the ability to precisely edit their own home movies with relative ease. Popular among avid consumer-level filmmakers for their size, this 16mm film equipment allows hand cranking and has a convenient frame counting dial. The reel arms can be swivelled out and locked in place for use, and folded away for compact storage.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Foyer → Entry → FSF-03. MPL exterior

group_siblings.title: 16mm projector
group_siblings.material_description:
-Ditmar 16mm projector no 2072
 - Internal cloth bound board used as a platform to store inside box.
 - Grey cord w Aus plug and a black cord w Euro plug.
 - Detachable feed arm
 - Huile Oil Ol original cardboard box and glass oil bottle inside.  The oil bottle still has 3 mm of oil at bottom which is fluid.  The cork lid of the bottle also has a tiny metal straw protruding from it to gather the oil.
 - Singer (brand) oil pourer with a removable nozzle.  Not from this set, but owner must have used it as one of many methods to oil the projector.
 - Tiny metal funnel for pouring oil into oil dropper.
 - One glass dropper with rubber end which is stored inside a cylindrical tube with lid.
 - One clear plastic dropper with remnants of oil inside top round squeezer.
 - Australian plug with nothing connected.
 - A small Euro plug which is backed on to wood and slots in the back of the machine.
 - An old paper rag
 - 2 spare belts in very delicate wax paper bags.  One of rubber (hardened) and one finely coiled metal (which has a kink in it).

results.title: Oh, Serafina!
results.brief_description: Augusto’s best friends are the birds that he talks to in the park while seeking refuge from his crazy and constantly arguing parents. After his father kills himself by jumping off the local bell-tower, Augusto reluctantly takes over the management of his family’s Mother-of-Pearl button factory, which in accordance with his own ecological beliefs, he refuses to industrialize. In his new workplace he is seduced by the ambitious Palmira, who he eventually marries, and who has him committed to a lunatic asylum where he meets the woman of his dreams, the ecologically-minded Serafina. In Italian language with no English subtitles.

results.title: Oh, boy! Babies!
results.creator_credit: Laughing Willow Company, Carole Hart and Gail Frank
results.brief_description: An infant care class is introduced as an elective in the curriculum of an upper primary school class in an American school. One boy disinterested at first comes to enjoy his time with the babies and learns that caring and nurturing are not restricted to the female gender. Raises points for discussion re male and female roles. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Oh! What a night
results.creator_credit: W H Productions, Keystone Film Company and Mack Sennett
results.brief_description: Charlie and Fatty, both well-dressed but very drunk, come home to their long-suffering wives in facing apartments in the same hotel. The women remonstrate so the men go off out again together to a restaurant where they create total chaos and mayhem and are finally ejected from the premises. They then stumble across a row boat in the park and climb in to try and get some sleep - as the film ends we see a sinking boat full of water! Cast: Charlie Chaplin, Fatty Arbuckle, Phyllis Allen and Minta Durfee

results.title: Oh sure
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Scott, Jerry Krepakevich and Richard Condie
results.brief_description: The subject of this film is unmistakable: how to make a fool of oneself easily and effectively. Two men are involved: one who wishes to read his newspaper and another who insists on performing acrobatic feats. Although the outcome is surprising, the message is clear; the film points out the futility of going to great lengths to impress one’s neighbor.

results.title: Oh No! It's the Franciscus Henri video
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Trish Foremen, Graham Slattery and Rob Pemberton
results.brief_description: Franciscus Henri has entertained children for many years with his wacky and original songs. After all, a man with a zoo in his house, wearing purple polka-dotted pyjamas, an octopus on his head and who can make unusual pancakes is not to be missed! Stroll with Franciscus Henri through the Milky Way and have lots of fun!

results.title: Oh brother, my brother (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Carol Lowell and Ross Lowell
results.brief_description: A look at the relationship between two young brothers showing the positive aspects of bonding, and portraying sibling rivalry. Suitable for upper primary, secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.
